bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 19 (Friday, February 3, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NEWHOUSE:H.R. 848.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3, commonly referred to as the``Commerce Clause'' of the United States Constitution.[Page H977]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E140-141)

Farm Regulatory Certainty Act

This bill amends the Resources Conservation and Recovery Act of 1976 to specify that animal waste, manure, and fertilizer are excluded from the Act's requirements if the waste, manure, or fertilizer originates from or is utilized by an agricultural operation.

Citizen suits may not be brought under the Act against an agricultural operation if federal or state legal and enforcement actions are already underway.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Farm Regulatory Certainty Act

item.title: To amend the Solid Waste Disposal Act to incentivize efficient nutrient management practices and to clarify the citizen suit provisions of such Act, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
